subject: Productivity
title: Anti-Fragile Prioritization
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Anti-Fragile Prioritization.

hook.text: Nassim Taleb says some things don't just survive shocks. They get stronger from them. He calls this antifragile.

buildup.text: Fragile systems break under stress. Robust systems survive. Antifragile systems improve from volatility.

discovery.text: Antifragile priorities are ones that benefit from uncertainty: learning, relationships, health, and optionality.

twist.text: Most planning assumes stability. But the world is volatile. Priorities that only work in calm conditions are fragile.

climax.text: The best strategies build optionality: many small bets instead of one big one. Upside without catastrophic downside.

punchline.text: Don't plan for stability. Plan to thrive in chaos.

quiz.question: What does antifragile mean?
options: Getting stronger from shocks and volatility
Staying exactly the same regardless of conditions
